description: Manage projects for an instance of the Azure Database Migration Service (classic).

commands.name: az dms project check-name
commands.summary: Check if a given project name is available within a given instance of DMS as well as the name's validity.

commands.name: az dms project create
commands.summary: Create a migration project which can contain multiple tasks.
examples: az dms project create -l westus -n sqlproject -g myresourcegroup --service-name mydms --source-platform SQL --target-platform SQLDB --tags tagName1=tagValue1 tagWithNoValue
az dms project create -l westus -n pgproject -g myresourcegroup --service-name mydms --source-platform PostgreSQL --target-platform AzureDbForPostgreSQL --tags tagName1=tagValue1 tagWithNoValue
az dms project create -l westus -n mysqlproject -g myresourcegroup --service-name mydms --source-platform MySQL --target-platform AzureDbForMySQL --tags tagName1=tagValue1 tagWithNoValue

commands.name: az dms project create
commands.summary: Create a migration project which can contain multiple tasks.
examples: az dms project create -l westus -n sqlproject -g myresourcegroup --service-name mydms --source-platform SQL --target-platform SQLDB --tags tagName1=tagValue1 tagWithNoValue
az dms project create -l westus -n pgproject -g myresourcegroup --service-name mydms --source-platform PostgreSQL --target-platform AzureDbForPostgreSQL --tags tagName1=tagValue1 tagWithNoValue

commands.name: az dms project delete
examples: az dms project delete --name MyProject --resource-group MyResourceGroup --service-name MyService

commands.name: az dms project list
commands.summary: List the projects within an instance of DMS.
examples: az dms project list --resource-group MyResourceGroup --service-name MyService

commands.name: az dms project show
commands.summary: Show the details of a migration project.
examples: az dms project show --name MyProject --resource-group MyResourceGroup --service-name MyService
